required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of E-cigarette Use on the Body

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines how electronic (e)-cigarette use impacts the body, by studying both users and non-users of e-cigarettes. Early evidence indicates that e-cig users experience adverse health effects. Results of this study may help policy-makers develop standards for different types of tobacco.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
Examine the short-term impacts of vaping on pulmonary and respiratory outcomes.
OUTLINE:
Current e-cigarette users will vape their own e-cigarette device ad libitum for 30 minutes; non-users will watch a neutral video for 30 minutes. Before and after the 30 minute vaping [video] session, participants will undergo the following assessments: computer-based spirometry testing, nitric oxide breath testing, airwave oscillometry, and an assessment of endothelial function. Participants will also undergo collection of blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Airway inflammation as assessed by exhaled nitric oxide
primary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure will last approximately 3 minutes; the procedure will occur twice during the laboratory session (separated by approximately 60 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Exhaled nitric oxide will be measured in parts per billion (ppb)

primary_outcome.measure: Airway reactivity as assessed by airwave oscillometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure will last approximately 3 minutes; the procedure will occur twice during the laboratory session (separated by approximately 60 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Airway reactivity will be measured via Tremoflo, which is a well validated measurement of airway reactivity and provides curves of Resistance (R) and Reactance (X)

primary_outcome.measure: Respiratory functioning as assessed by a mobile Spirometry device
primary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure will last approximately 3 minutes; the procedure will occur twice during the laboratory session (separated by approximately 60 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Spirometry will collect daily data from participants on the relationship between their forced expiratory volume and forced vital capacity (measured as FEV1/FVC).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure will last approximately 20 minutes; the procedure will occur twice during the laboratory session (separated by approximately 90 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Endothelial function will be assessed with the EndoPAT device (unit of measurement = LnRHI).

arm_group.description: Participants undergo computer-based spirometry testing, nitric oxide breath testing, airwave oscillometry, and an assessment of endothelial function. Participants will undergo collection of blood. Current e-cigarette users also vape their own e-cigarette device for 30 minutes.

intervention.description: Endothelial function will be assessed with the EndoPAT device, which measures changes in pressure from sensors placed on the fingertip

study_pop.textblock: E-cig (cigarette) users and non-users in Ohio

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 75 e-cig users and 75 never-users
- No self-reported diagnosis of lung disease (e.g., coronavirus disease-2019 [COVID-19], pneumonia, cystic fibrosis)
- No history of cardiac event or distress
- Not currently breastfeeding, pregnant, or planning to become pregnant (e-cig users only; will be confirmed via pregnancy test)

overall_official.affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

overall_contact.last_name: The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center
